meanings.sent1: Be careful not to reinjure your knee while playing.
meanings.sent2: He was worried that he might reinjure his back lifting heavy boxes.
meanings.sent3: After he slipped on a banana peel, he joked that he might reinjure his pride.
meanings.sent4: Her harsh words seemed to reinjure his wounded feelings.
meanings.sent5: The fragile vase teetered on the edge of the table, threatening to reinjure itself.

meanings.sent1: The athlete was advised to rest to avoid reinjuring his ankle.
meanings.sent2: She was cautious not to reinjure her sprained wrist during the dance performance.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy puppy managed to reinjure its paw while chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The old scar seemed to reinjure every time he bumped his elbow.
meanings.sent5: The fragile friendship was delicate, ready to reinjure at the slightest disagreement.
